00020 /// Fixture for tests involving Plan.
00021 // Though Plan doesn't use State, it's useful to have one around
00022 // to create Nodes and Edges.
00023 struct PlanTest : public StateTestWithBuiltinRules {
00024   Plan plan_;
00025 };
00026 
00027 TEST_F(PlanTest, Basic) {
00028   AssertParse(&state_,
00029 "build out: cat mid\n"
00030 "build mid: cat in\n");
00031   GetNode("mid")->dirty_ = true;
00032   GetNode("out")->dirty_ = true;
00033   string err;
00034   EXPECT_TRUE(plan_.AddTarget(GetNode("out"), &err));
00035   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00036   ASSERT_TRUE(plan_.more_to_do());
00037 
00038   Edge* edge = plan_.FindWork();
00039   ASSERT_TRUE(edge);
00040   ASSERT_EQ("in",  edge->inputs_[0]->file_->path_);
00041   ASSERT_EQ("mid", edge->outputs_[0]->file_->path_);
00042 
00043   ASSERT_FALSE(plan_.FindWork());
00044 
00045   GetNode("mid")->dirty_ = false;
00046   plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00047 
00048   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00049   ASSERT_TRUE(edge);
00050   ASSERT_EQ("mid", edge->inputs_[0]->file_->path_);
00051   ASSERT_EQ("out", edge->outputs_[0]->file_->path_);
00052 
00053   GetNode("out")->dirty_ = false;
00054   plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00055 
00056   ASSERT_FALSE(plan_.more_to_do());
00057   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00058   ASSERT_EQ(NULL, edge);
00059 }
00060 
00061 // Test that two outputs from one rule can be handled as inputs to the next.
00062 TEST_F(PlanTest, DoubleOutputDirect) {
00063   AssertParse(&state_,
00064 "build out: cat mid1 mid2\n"
00065 "build mid1 mid2: cat in\n");
00066   GetNode("mid1")->dirty_ = true;
00067   GetNode("mid2")->dirty_ = true;
00068   GetNode("out")->dirty_ = true;
00069 
00070   string err;
00071   EXPECT_TRUE(plan_.AddTarget(GetNode("out"), &err));
00072   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00073   ASSERT_TRUE(plan_.more_to_do());
00074 
00075   Edge* edge;
00076   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00077   ASSERT_TRUE(edge);  // cat in
00078   GetNode("mid1")->dirty_ = false;
00079   GetNode("mid2")->dirty_ = false;
00080   plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00081 
00082   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00083   ASSERT_TRUE(edge);  // cat mid1 mid2
00084   GetNode("in")->dirty_ = false;
00085   plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00086 
00087   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00088   ASSERT_FALSE(edge);  // done
00089 }
00090 
00091 // Test that two outputs from one rule can eventually be routed to another.
00092 TEST_F(PlanTest, DoubleOutputIndirect) {
00093   AssertParse(&state_,
00094 "build out: cat b1 b2\n"
00095 "build b1: cat a1\n"
00096 "build b2: cat a2\n"
00097 "build a1 a2: cat in\n");
00098   GetNode("a1")->dirty_ = true;
00099   GetNode("a2")->dirty_ = true;
00100   GetNode("b1")->dirty_ = true;
00101   GetNode("b2")->dirty_ = true;
00102   GetNode("out")->dirty_ = true;
00103   string err;
00104   EXPECT_TRUE(plan_.AddTarget(GetNode("out"), &err));
00105   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00106   ASSERT_TRUE(plan_.more_to_do());
00107 
00108   Edge* edge;
00109   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00110   ASSERT_TRUE(edge);  // cat in
00111   GetNode("a1")->dirty_ = false;
00112   GetNode("a2")->dirty_ = false;
00113   plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00114 
00115   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00116   ASSERT_TRUE(edge);  // cat a1
00117   GetNode("b1")->dirty_ = false;
00118   plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00119 
00120   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00121   ASSERT_TRUE(edge);  // cat a2
00122   GetNode("b2")->dirty_ = false;
00123   plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00124 
00125   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00126   ASSERT_TRUE(edge);  // cat b1 b2
00127   GetNode("out")->dirty_ = false;
00128   plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00129 
00130   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00131   ASSERT_FALSE(edge);  // done
00132 }

00134 // Test that two edges from one output can both execute.
00135 TEST_F(PlanTest, DoubleDependent) {
00136   AssertParse(&state_,
00137 "build out: cat a1 a2\n"
00138 "build a1: cat mid\n"
00139 "build a2: cat mid\n"
00140 "build mid: cat in\n");
00141   GetNode("mid")->dirty_ = true;
00142   GetNode("a1")->dirty_ = true;
00143   GetNode("a2")->dirty_ = true;
00144   GetNode("out")->dirty_ = true;
00145 
00146   string err;
00147   EXPECT_TRUE(plan_.AddTarget(GetNode("out"), &err));
00148   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00149   ASSERT_TRUE(plan_.more_to_do());
00150 
00151   Edge* edge;
00152   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00153   ASSERT_TRUE(edge);  // cat in
00154   GetNode("mid")->dirty_ = false;
00155   plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00156 
00157   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00158   ASSERT_TRUE(edge);  // cat mid
00159   GetNode("a1")->dirty_ = false;
00160   plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00161 
00162   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00163   ASSERT_TRUE(edge);  // cat mid
00164   GetNode("a2")->dirty_ = false;
00165   plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00166 
00167   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00168   ASSERT_TRUE(edge);  // cat a1 a2
00169   GetNode("out")->dirty_ = false;
00170   plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00171 
00172   edge = plan_.FindWork();
00173   ASSERT_FALSE(edge);  // done
00174 }

00176 TEST_F(PlanTest, DependencyCycle) {
00177   AssertParse(&state_,
00178 "build out: cat mid\n"
00179 "build mid: cat in\n"
00180 "build in: cat pre\n"
00181 "build pre: cat out\n");
00182   GetNode("out")->dirty_ = true;
00183   GetNode("mid")->dirty_ = true;
00184   GetNode("in")->dirty_ = true;
00185   GetNode("pre")->dirty_ = true;
00186 
00187   string err;
00188   EXPECT_FALSE(plan_.AddTarget(GetNode("out"), &err));
00189   ASSERT_EQ("dependency cycle: out -> mid -> in -> pre -> out", err);
00190 }

00192 struct BuildTest : public StateTestWithBuiltinRules,
00193                    public CommandRunner {
00194   BuildTest() : config_(MakeConfig()), builder_(&state_, config_), now_(1),
00195                 last_command_(NULL) {
00196     builder_.disk_interface_ = &fs_;
00197     builder_.command_runner_ = this;
00198     AssertParse(&state_,
00199 "build cat1: cat in1\n"
00200 "build cat2: cat in1 in2\n"
00201 "build cat12: cat cat1 cat2\n");
00202 
00203     fs_.Create("in1", now_, "");
00204     fs_.Create("in2", now_, "");
00205   }
00206 
00207   // Mark a path dirty.
00208   void Dirty(const string& path);
00209 
00210   // CommandRunner impl
00211   virtual bool CanRunMore();
00212   virtual bool StartCommand(Edge* edge);
00213   virtual bool WaitForCommands();
00214   virtual Edge* NextFinishedCommand(bool* success);
00215 
00216   BuildConfig MakeConfig() {
00217     BuildConfig config;
00218     config.verbosity = BuildConfig::QUIET;
00219     return config;
00220   }
00221 
00222   BuildConfig config_;
00223   Builder builder_;
00224   int now_;
00225 
00226   VirtualFileSystem fs_;
00227 
00228   vector<string> commands_ran_;
00229   Edge* last_command_;
00230 };
00231 
00232 void BuildTest::Dirty(const string& path) {
00233   Node* node = GetNode(path);
00234   node->dirty_ = true;
00235 
00236   // If it's an input file, mark that we've already stat()ed it and
00237   // it's missing.
00238   if (!node->in_edge_)
00239     node->file_->mtime_ = 0;
00240 }
00241 
00242 bool BuildTest::CanRunMore() {
00243   // Only run one at a time.
00244   return last_command_ == NULL;
00245 }
00246 
00247 bool BuildTest::StartCommand(Edge* edge) {
00248   assert(!last_command_);
00249   commands_ran_.push_back(edge->EvaluateCommand());
00250   if (edge->rule_->name_ == "cat" || edge->rule_->name_ == "cc") {
00251     for (vector<Node*>::iterator out = edge->outputs_.begin();
00252          out != edge->outputs_.end(); ++out) {
00253       (*out)->file_->mtime_ = now_;
00254       (*out)->dirty_ = false;
00255     }
00256     last_command_ = edge;
00257     return true;
00258   } else {
00259     printf("unkown command\n");
00260   }
00261 
00262   return false;
00263 }
00264 
00265 bool BuildTest::WaitForCommands() {
00266   assert(last_command_);
00267   return true;
00268 }
00269 
00270 Edge* BuildTest::NextFinishedCommand(bool* success) {
00271   if (Edge* edge = last_command_) {
00272     *success = true;
00273     last_command_ = NULL;
00274     return edge;
00275   }
00276   return NULL;
00277 }
00278 
00279 TEST_F(BuildTest, NoWork) {
00280   string err;
00281   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00282   EXPECT_EQ("no work to do", err);
00283   EXPECT_EQ(0, commands_ran_.size());
00284 }
00285 
00286 TEST_F(BuildTest, OneStep) {
00287   // Given a dirty target with one ready input,
00288   // we should rebuild the target.
00289   Dirty("cat1");
00290   string err;
00291   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.AddTarget("cat1", &err));
00292   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00293   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00294   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00295 
00296   ASSERT_EQ(1, commands_ran_.size());
00297   EXPECT_EQ("cat in1 > cat1", commands_ran_[0]);
00298 }
00299 
00300 TEST_F(BuildTest, OneStep2) {
00301   // Given a target with one dirty input,
00302   // we should rebuild the target.
00303   Dirty("cat1");
00304   string err;
00305   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.AddTarget("cat1", &err));
00306   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00307   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00308   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00309 
00310   ASSERT_EQ(1, commands_ran_.size());
00311   EXPECT_EQ("cat in1 > cat1", commands_ran_[0]);
00312 }
00313 
00314 TEST_F(BuildTest, TwoStep) {
00315   string err;
00316   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.AddTarget("cat12", &err));
00317   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00318   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00319   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00320   ASSERT_EQ(3, commands_ran_.size());
00321   // Depending on how the pointers work out, we could've ran
00322   // the first two commands in either order.
00323   EXPECT_TRUE((commands_ran_[0] == "cat in1 > cat1" &&
00324                commands_ran_[1] == "cat in1 in2 > cat2") ||
00325               (commands_ran_[1] == "cat in1 > cat1" &&
00326                commands_ran_[0] == "cat in1 in2 > cat2"));
00327 
00328   EXPECT_EQ("cat cat1 cat2 > cat12", commands_ran_[2]);
00329 
00330   // Modifying in2 requires rebuilding one intermediate file
00331   // and the final file.
00332   GetNode("cat2")->dirty_ = true;
00333   GetNode("cat12")->dirty_ = true;
00334   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.AddTarget("cat12", &err));
00335   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00336   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00337   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00338   ASSERT_EQ(5, commands_ran_.size());
00339   EXPECT_EQ("cat in1 in2 > cat2", commands_ran_[3]);
00340   EXPECT_EQ("cat cat1 cat2 > cat12", commands_ran_[4]);
00341 }
00342 
00343 TEST_F(BuildTest, Chain) {
00344   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00345 "build c2: cat c1\n"
00346 "build c3: cat c2\n"
00347 "build c4: cat c3\n"
00348 "build c5: cat c4\n"));
00349 
00350   fs_.Create("c1", now_, "");
00351 
00352   string err;
00353   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.AddTarget("c5", &err));
00354   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00355   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00356   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00357   ASSERT_EQ(4, commands_ran_.size());
00358 
00359   err.clear();
00360   commands_ran_.clear();
00361   EXPECT_FALSE(builder_.AddTarget("c5", &err));
00362   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00363   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00364   ASSERT_EQ(0, commands_ran_.size());
00365 
00366   GetNode("c4")->dirty_ = true;
00367   GetNode("c5")->dirty_ = true;
00368   err.clear();
00369   commands_ran_.clear();
00370   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.AddTarget("c5", &err));
00371   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00372   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00373   ASSERT_EQ(2, commands_ran_.size());  // 3->4, 4->5
00374 }

00376 TEST_F(BuildTest, MissingInput) {
00377   // Input is referenced by build file, but no rule for it.
00378   string err;
00379   Dirty("in1");
00380   EXPECT_FALSE(builder_.AddTarget("cat1", &err));
00381   EXPECT_EQ("'in1', needed by 'cat1', missing and no known rule to make it",
00382             err);
00383 }

00385 TEST_F(BuildTest, MissingTarget) {
00386   // Target is not referenced by build file.
00387   string err;
00388   EXPECT_FALSE(builder_.AddTarget("meow", &err));
00389   EXPECT_EQ("unknown target: 'meow'", err);
00390 }

00392 TEST_F(BuildTest, MakeDirs) {
00393   string err;
00394   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00395 "build subdir/dir2/file: cat in1\n"));
00396 
00397   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.AddTarget("subdir/dir2/file", &err));
00398   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00399   now_ = 0;  // Make all stat()s return file not found.
00400   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00401   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00402   ASSERT_EQ(2, fs_.directories_made_.size());
00403   EXPECT_EQ("subdir", fs_.directories_made_[0]);
00404   EXPECT_EQ("subdir/dir2", fs_.directories_made_[1]);
00405 }

00407 TEST_F(BuildTest, DepFileMissing) {
00408   string err;
00409   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00410 "rule cc\n  command = cc $in\n  depfile = $out.d\n"
00411 "build foo.o: cc foo.c\n"));
00412   fs_.Create("foo.c", now_, "");
00413 
00414   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.AddTarget("foo.o", &err));
00415   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00416   ASSERT_EQ(1, fs_.files_read_.size());
00417   EXPECT_EQ("foo.o.d", fs_.files_read_[0]);
00418 }

00420 TEST_F(BuildTest, DepFileOK) {
00421   string err;
00422   int orig_edges = state_.edges_.size();
00423   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00424 "rule cc\n  command = cc $in\n  depfile = $out.d\n"
00425 "build foo.o: cc foo.c\n"));
00426   fs_.Create("foo.c", now_, "");
00427   GetNode("bar.h")->dirty_ = true;  // Mark bar.h as missing.
00428   fs_.Create("foo.o.d", now_, "foo.o: blah.h bar.h\n");
00429   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.AddTarget("foo.o", &err));
00430   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00431   ASSERT_EQ(1, fs_.files_read_.size());
00432   EXPECT_EQ("foo.o.d", fs_.files_read_[0]);
00433 
00434   // Expect our edge to now have three inputs: foo.c and two headers.
00435   ASSERT_EQ(orig_edges + 1, state_.edges_.size());
00436   Edge* edge = state_.edges_.back();
00437   ASSERT_EQ(3, edge->inputs_.size());
00438 
00439   // Expect the command line we generate to only use the original input.
00440   ASSERT_EQ("cc foo.c", edge->EvaluateCommand());
00441 }
00442 
00443 TEST_F(BuildTest, DepFileParseError) {
00444   string err;
00445   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00446 "rule cc\n  command = cc $in\n  depfile = $out.d\n"
00447 "build foo.o: cc foo.c\n"));
00448   fs_.Create("foo.c", now_, "");
00449   fs_.Create("foo.o.d", now_, "foo.o blah.h bar.h\n");
00450   EXPECT_FALSE(builder_.AddTarget("foo.o", &err));
00451   EXPECT_EQ("foo.o.d: line 1, col 7: expected ':', got 'blah.h'", err);
00452 }
00453 
00454 TEST_F(BuildTest, OrderOnlyDeps) {
00455   string err;
00456   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00457 "rule cc\n  command = cc $in\n  depfile = $out.d\n"
00458 "build foo.o: cc foo.c || otherfile\n"));
00459   fs_.Create("foo.c", now_, "");
00460   fs_.Create("otherfile", now_, "");
00461   fs_.Create("foo.o.d", now_, "foo.o: blah.h bar.h\n");
00462   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.AddTarget("foo.o", &err));
00463   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00464 
00465   Edge* edge = state_.edges_.back();
00466   // One explicit, two implicit, one order only.
00467   ASSERT_EQ(4, edge->inputs_.size());
00468   EXPECT_EQ(2, edge->implicit_deps_);
00469   EXPECT_EQ(1, edge->order_only_deps_);
00470   // Verify the inputs are in the order we expect
00471   // (explicit then implicit then orderonly).
00472   EXPECT_EQ("foo.c", edge->inputs_[0]->file_->path_);
00473   EXPECT_EQ("blah.h", edge->inputs_[1]->file_->path_);
00474   EXPECT_EQ("bar.h", edge->inputs_[2]->file_->path_);
00475   EXPECT_EQ("otherfile", edge->inputs_[3]->file_->path_);
00476 
00477   // Expect the command line we generate to only use the original input.
00478   ASSERT_EQ("cc foo.c", edge->EvaluateCommand());
00479 
00480   // explicit dep dirty, expect a rebuild.
00481   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00482   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00483   ASSERT_EQ(1, commands_ran_.size());
00484 
00485   // implicit dep dirty, expect a rebuild.
00486   commands_ran_.clear();
00487   GetNode("blah.h")->dirty_ = true;
00488   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.AddTarget("foo.o", &err));
00489   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00490   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00491   ASSERT_EQ(1, commands_ran_.size());
00492 
00493   // order only dep dirty, no rebuild.
00494   commands_ran_.clear();
00495   GetNode("otherfile")->dirty_ = true;
00496   // We should fail to even add the depenency on foo.o, because
00497   // there's nothing to do.
00498   EXPECT_FALSE(builder_.AddTarget("foo.o", &err));
00499 }
00500 
00501 TEST_F(BuildTest, Phony) {
00502   string err;
00503   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00504 "build out: cat bar.cc\n"
00505 "build all: phony out\n"));
00506   fs_.Create("bar.cc", now_, "");
00507 
00508   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.AddTarget("all", &err));
00509   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00510 
00511   // Only one command to run, because phony runs no command.
00512   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00513   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00514   ASSERT_EQ(1, commands_ran_.size());
00515 
00516   EXPECT_TRUE(builder_.Build(&err));
00517   ASSERT_NE("", err);
00518 }
